snippet: President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf acknowledged on Wednesday that she had made a mistake in ordering a tough security crackdown at the height of the Ebola crisis last year.
abstract: Liberian Pres Ellen Johnson Sirleaf admits mistakes in her early response to Ebola, when she deployed military personnel and police and sealed off neighborhood in Monrovia in effort to contain disease, moves that created distrust and unrest; Sirleaf says fear of 'unknown enemy' prompted her response; Liberia's Ebola rates have since declined drastically.
lead_paragraph: President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf acknowledged on Wednesday that she had made a mistake in ordering a tough security crackdown at the height of the Ebola crisis last year.

headline.main: Liberian Leader Concedes Errors in Response to Ebola
headline.print_headline: Liberian Leader Concedes Errors in Response to Ebola
